cause.description:
Suicide is the 2nd leading cause of death for American college students.
There is 1 suicide every 16 minutes.
Suicide deaths consistently outnumber homicide deaths by a margin of three to two.
There are more suicides globally than deaths from war and inter-personal violence COMBINED.
Approximately twice as many Americans die by suicides than from HIV/AIDS.
AND YET
More than 90 percent of people who die by suicide have depression or another diagnosable mental/substance abuse disorder.
78 percent of Americans think that many suicides are preventable with appropriate research, interventions and services
86 percent of Americans surveyed think it is important to invest in the prevention of suicide.
Then Why is it still such a problem?
Click Here to support federal funding for suicide prevention programs on college campuses and state/tribal governments.
Click Here to support all suicide legislation.
1. Suicide is PREVENTABLE. 2. College campuses NEED increased federal support for suicide prevention. 3. Stigma is DESTRUCTIVE. 4. Each individual CAN make a difference.
cause.mission: Opening Minds. Changing Policy. Saving Lives.
